utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You have a patient waiting, see?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm waiting for a follow-up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: If you're talking about Mr. Kazden, he has a deceased sticker on his file. As do all the other follow-ups you have scheduled for today. Whoops.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I had colds all winter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've been in this room a while, but it's spring now, right?

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I feel run-down like maybe something big is coming on.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Run-down. Come on, give me something. Sore throat?

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Runny nose?

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: No. I know it sounds weird, I'm a nurse, but could you run maybe a CBC or thyroid up —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy, I need a consult. Until she stops seizing, I may as well go back to my office and get my diagnosis on.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She's urinating on herself.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's having a seizure. If she hadn't peed it would…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's green.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 35-year-old woman. Head of nursing at an old age home.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Neurological symptoms and "P"? Oh, green pee. I get it. Nice.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: "Neuro" is also written in green. Does that mean she has green neurological symptoms as well?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: From now on I'm gonna use two colors. Green indicates irony.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Pseudomonas infection.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She'd have a fever. Toxins?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why are we taking this case?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Welcome, your lordship. We were just preparing your morning briefing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry I'm late. And, yes, green pee does meet the only diagnostic requirement you care about… it's interesting. But is it worth us taking this case?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Us" aren't taking anything. I'm taking. You're accepting.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay, I accept. She has adult-onset epilepsy, and she really likes those Saint Patrick's Day beers.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go check out the house and the office for toxins and infections.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Her neuro exam was normal. No subsequent seizures. It's not life-threatening. It's not important.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Luckily, neither are you.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You and House this morning, the way you were arguing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Airing disagreements doesn't qualify as arguing.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Come on, man. I'm just trying to help. We're friends.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There are 400 Japanese teenagers you were playing Halo with last night you're better friends with. Your avatar should ask their avatars how they're doing.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I consider you a good friend even if we don't hang that much outside work.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I wasn't arguing with him.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You kinda were.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Fine, I was. And you know what, I was right.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You got conned. Methylthioninium chloride. Notable side effect, green urine. She's a nurse. She knows the dosage. Knows how to fake a seizure. She pees pea soup and gets the warm attention of doctors all week long. She's a Munchausen and you're her mark.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So your insight is based on discovering an anti-Alzheimer's drug at an old-age home.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No good reason it'd be sitting in her desk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You ever tried to pee on yourself in public? It's not easy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry, I rushed the Jewish frat. We peed in private.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For good reason. I can spot a fake seizure. Which means this was real. Which means her problem is phenol.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Carbolic acid? Yeah, maybe she accidentally inhaled some at a gout treatment facility circa 1890.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's still in some antiseptic throat sprays. She's been chugging it all winter for her colds. Phenol explains the seizure and the urine.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She'd have to drink five bottles a day.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which is why I'm sure you won't have trouble discovering evidence of it when you search her house. Bye. And you can start her on charcoal hemoperfusion for the phenol poisoning. Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Oh, you were lying about the throat spray. That does make more sense. So why are you wasting Taub's time?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because I don't want him to know that I'm wasting my time disproving his fake seizure theory. Zip.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Chris? Chris Taub, right? Neil Zane. I was two years under you at Collegiate High, remember?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: So you're some big doctor here now?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm a doctor. You?

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: I was speaking at an econ course over at the university. I tripped and banged my leg.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I have some time. Come with me.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: Hi. Tests back?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Head CT was negative.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: What about a thyroid uptake or abdominal ultrasound?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure. How about I flash some lights in front of your face first?

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: You want me to have another seizure?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're gonna have to give up the room unless we can confirm a problem.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dammit.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: Please forgive me, I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are you worried about? You have maybe a night in jail for fraud. I have to go tell one of my employees he was right.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I'm not a Munchausen. I'm gonna die unless you help me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You'll have to come up with something more original.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: A cat predicted my death.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cats make terrible doctors. Oh no, wait, that's women. You're screwed.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How'd you slip?

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Oh, I've had this dizziness problem for a while now.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You get checked for labyrinthitis?

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: On antibiotics for a week. No difference.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lie down a sec.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, I'm dizzy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's normal. So what are you teaching?

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Entrepreneurship. I'm a CEO, Ost Tech Industries. We make medical devices.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: All right, you can sit up.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: So did that tell you anything? Did I… Oh, my God. The… you just cured me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I figured you had a tiny calcium deposit in your inner ear. I just shifted it around.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: I've seen three doctors for this. I'm buying you dinner.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Forget it.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Come on. I'm also an investor in a club. We'll make it a night out.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, I'm married. Boring.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: I know some married people who aren't boring.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: A few years back, I was one of them. Good luck, Neil.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you're going to kill me and rape me, please do it in that order.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: This is the cat, Debbie. Have you heard of her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Debbie. Sorry, but without a last name…

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: She was in the news. We found her as a kitten. She lives in the nursing home. She only sleeps next to people when they're about to die. Ten patients in the last year. And then yesterday she did it to me while I was sitting on my couch. Please, the whole staff, the doctors even, we all know this is real.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can you come back later? I have some business I’m conducting with the Prince of Nigeria.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: Just watch this video. It'll prove I'm not lying. Dr. House, I am begging you. Chest.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Quick! Before she goes without attention for eight seconds.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's faking. The cat told me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Listen. Soft breath sounds. Means it's bronchospasm. Can't fake that.

utterance.speaker: TV Announcer
utterance.content: Debbie the cat spends most of her time just prowling the halls, the queen of her own private world.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Gotta say, I don't think the changes they've made to American Idol really work for me.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: When Debbie climbs on a patient's bed and goes to sleep, we call the loved ones and tell them to come in.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You want to treat her? She's a nut job.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't we all have quirks? Aren't those eccentricities what make us human?

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: It's like Debbie's here on earth to bring people to the other side.

utterance.speaker: TV Announcer
utterance.content: The doctors we spoke to also agree…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nut jobs get sick too.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So you think this cat story is nonsense. And you admit she faked her earlier symptoms. But you still think she's actually sick now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, anything would sound ridiculous if you said it in that voice.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Confirm she's faking or I'm gonna have to kick her out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's that voice again.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'll give you 24 hours.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Consecutive?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, Mister Bond, I expect you to die. Bronchospasm, go.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Bronchitis.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No cough, no fever, and Blofeld didn’t smoke a cigar.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He might have. Dude had a lair. Means he was rich. Rich people enjoy a good stogie, sometimes send them as gifts. Hey, Taub! Did that sound like I was awkwardly trying to segue into making a point?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Emphysema.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Lungs were clean on the CT. Dogs can be trained to predict diabetic comas, epileptic seizures; they can smell cancer. It is possible there's something in this cat.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's more possible that it was just a coincidence. 10 million nursing homes.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Debbie was able to predict there was something wrong with the patient before you were. Is that a coincidence too?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe the cat didn't predict anything. Might have caused the deaths.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We shoulda listened to Ted Nugent.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, it could be cat scratch fever or visceral larva migrans. Maybe he didn't kill everyone at the nursing home, but it may be killing Morgan.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The worms hop from the cat to the cat lady's lungs. I could buy that.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Those cigars were for me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, that reminds me, why is some fancy CEO sending you a box of Cuban cigars? Is it related to your money worries?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: What money worries?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Extrapolating from the fact that he's been skipping his morning muffin, I'd say that he lost almost all his money on the market last year.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm on a diet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm also extrapolating from the online portfolio you forget to log off. But it's mostly the muffins. Scope her for worms in the lungs.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: We could help out in there.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah, it takes at least four people to look inside a crazy woman's lungs for imaginary worms.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: So you're in a good mood again. You need another speech about what a great friend I am?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm telling my wife we don't need to downsize, but maybe we do.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You really lost all that money?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't care about the money. I just feel bad for Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She married a guy in one situation and ended up with another. That's hard on anyone.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thanks. Makes me feel much better hearing my wife's a gold digger.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: No, I just meant she married this master of the universe, successful surgeon, and now he's basically, you know, a flunky for this mad scientist… who saves lives, so that's good.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: There are no worms in the lungs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What else could cause bronchospasm?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Severe acid reflux.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No esophagitis. It's not reflux.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Why are you pushing a crash cart?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because patients sometimes crash, and they haven't yet invented a crash tractor for me to drive wildly around the hallways.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Why are we in the coma patients’ room?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You actually think the cat is going to predict someone's death?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I know the cat is not going to predict anyone's death. Then I will have scientifically disproved…

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You didn't keep this patient despite the cat, you kept this patient because of the cat. You're scared there's something to it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If I could prove the non-existence of an omniscient God who lovingly guides us to the other side, I would. Cat version will have to do. Are you scared?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Cats' brains are always in alpha mode. The few scientific tests that have seemed to confirm psychic phenomena, that's where it takes place.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Please tell me that you were kidding so I won't have to fire you.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I was kidding.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We still have a human patient, right? Airborne allergens possible?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Skin test was negative.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Lungs may be more sensitive.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or House just screwed up. If you misinterpreted the breath sounds as soft instead of loud, it's laryngospasm instead of bronchospasm, which you can get from a simple panic attack, which she was having.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I also heard the lung sounds too, Taub. You saying I screwed up?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: "Screwed up" is maybe too harsh, but yes.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Don't you want to check their charts?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course not. This is a double-blind. I don't want to even subconsciously

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Her name's Debbie.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Are those welts on that guy's arm?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Were they here when we got here?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He has a severe cat allergy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That never happened.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Look at Debbie.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good news, Mister… Limpert, when you don't die tonight you will finally have done something good for the world as opposed to your life as a… fireman. Foreman's airborne allergen theory makes the most sense. Do a methacholine challenge on Catgirl to check it out.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I told you to get rid of "death cat."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you see a cat?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I see a litter box.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is a disability, Dr. Cuddy. Can't make it to the men's room on time.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You pee on the mice too?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, now you see the mice actually prove that I don't have a cat.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are these… are these the genetically modified lab mice from oncology?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Genetically modified for tastiness.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Get rid of the cat and get rid of your patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My team's doing a methacholine challenge.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your team just completed a methacholine challenge, which came up negative.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who told you about the test? Taub?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'll never say. But yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Her airways clamped down. I heard it. We kick her onto the street, it could happen again. I wish there was a lawsuit cat. It could warn you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm sorry, but if you won't escort her out, I'll have to get security to do it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re joining me for a good-bye smoke.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I don't smoke.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. If you don't want the seventh graders to think you're cool. I went through your purse. Horoscopes. Good luck charms. You went to a good college, good nursing school. So you weren't always a superstitious idiot.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I'm not a super…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How 'bout four years, that sound right? That's when you switched from a family insurance plan to the one you're on now.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I was married. I got divorced.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two years before that, you got chicken pox shots, which you only get in adulthood when you have a kid. Or I should say when you had a kid because no kid has come to visit you. Which all makes me think something bad happened.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: It was my stepson, Timothy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: He was in school. He was having his morning snack. And he choked. And the teacher saw it and they did everything that they were supposed to. He shouldn't have died.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You want to make it make sense.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: What’s wrong with that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s meaningless, is what’s wrong. What’s wrong is that it doesn’t do a thing to bring your kid back, or put you and your ex together again. Rash on your neck. Probably not enough for Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I can't breathe.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, doc. Breath sound soft to you, doc? Hooray! You're officially sick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Churg-Strauss fits best. Here's the plan… Taub, change the litter box.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This is pathetic. You're still punishing me for calling you out on the green urine lady?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope, this is for ratting me out to Cuddy. I'm not asking you to apologize, just scoop some poop out of a box.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Just clean it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Let House do it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, that'll happen. He won't just continue to let our room smell like cat pee. I'll clean it next time.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm outta here.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Now that you've delivered that important lesson, I'm gonna go test the patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What, you think your bag's gonna die now?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Now you're punishing me because you think I'm superstitious? What do you care?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not so much about me caring per se. It's more about me wondering why you're such a credulous idiot. Thirteen, start the patient on steroids for the Churg-Strauss. Unless we have something we need to argue about.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This is good stuff.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: The best. It's made from the distilled sweat of recently laid-off hedge fund managers. Aren't you happy you came out tonight?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah. I wasn't actually going to, but not the greatest day at work. I used to have an office like this.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Used to?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: When I was a plastic surgeon. But one day I took stock of my life and … Uh, screw it. I had an affair with the daughter of one of my partners. They signed a non-disclosure. I signed a non-compete. And the funny thing is I wound up telling my wife anyway. You like your job?

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Same as you. Same as everyone. It has its ups and downs.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're lying to make me feel better.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Yeah, it's the best. I'm in charge, you know? I'm a kid with toys. Speaking of which, what do you think of the prototype?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's amazing. Gotta make it a half-inch smaller though.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: You serious?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I got small hands, 6.5 gloves, like women surgeons, which are your fastest-growing market. Meaning the girls would have to use two hands to hit the switch.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Why do I bother paying the idiots that work for me? Put down that crap you're drinking, because I am breaking out the really good stuff.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I went to the bathroom. My urine…

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Green again?

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: It's brown. I didn't do anything, honest.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm just a girl who can't say no.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It is possible she's still faking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She didn't fake the bronchospasm. You think she's faking some stuff but not other stuff? Maybe she's "Unchausen".

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm just saying the brown urine doesn't make sense.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We've ruled out every possible cause for brown urine. No blood in the urine. Liver and kidneys fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Brown could be fecal. A fistula…

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We checked.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How do we know the urine is still brown?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Had to be. Once you've gone brown…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If we've ruled out everything that can make the urine brown, what if it just looked brown? If the green dye never left her system, what plus green makes brown?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Purple. Strep bovis infection from colon cancer. Paraneoplastic syndrome would explain the bronchospasm.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We scoped her when we checked for the fistula. There's no tumor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I wasn't scared by the umbrella either.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What? Not everything's about you, Kutner.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I realize it's stupid. I just… I don't know everything. I don't want to invite…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great, 'cause I thought your superstitiousness had to do with your folks being killed. But "you're stupid" works just as well.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why is there a ladder here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oops. Forgot that one. Scopes don't work as well as pillcams. Give her one. Find the tumor. Come with me, tiny Taub.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry I was late again. I've got a long commute from the poor house.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Knew it when I hired you. You'd eventually miss the money, being the big shot like your new CEO friend, if that night club stamp on your hand is any indication.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Don't worry, I'm not quitting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. Guy who signs a non-compete instead of just telling his wife that he cheated doesn't have the guts to quit.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Bad example. I did tell her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: From guilt, not from courage. And bravely running to Cuddy behind my back. Arriving heroically late every day. Cowards make lousy employees. Maybe you're a coward, maybe you're quitting. Either way, I'm screwed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You will note how “Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!” has snuggled up by Coma Guy over there. And more importantly, she did yesterday as well. And he's still breathing. We done?

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: Thank you for showing me this. But maybe she's just confused in this new environment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: In 1844 a preacher in upstate New York added up some dates in the bible and predicted Jesus' return. His followers gave away all their possessions and showed up in a field. Guess who didn't show. So the preacher said that he miscalculated, and they went right back the next month but with more followers. Every time he was irrefutably proved wrong, it redoubled everyone's belief.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I know I sound just like them, but I also know you’re wrong. Something terrible’s gonna happen to me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re trying to prove to her she's not dying?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That would be dumb as she might be dying.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This woman lost her kid. Why are you attacking beliefs that give her a little bit of comfort?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't care if her superstitions make her feel better. I just want her to think more clearly.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh. Maybe that could make her as happy as you are. Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Experimenting. Stop it, Dr. Wilson. It’s just not cute anymore!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You already experimented on the coma guy. Haven't you proved your point?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not to the patient. And not to the millions of idiots who drooled over that news item about the magic cat.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why are you so obsessed with this? Can't you just call her an idiot and leave everyone alone?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, look, kids, therapy cat.

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: You're a liar. Therapy animals are dogs, not cats.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Aren't you feisty? This one's special. If she likes you interesting stuff happens.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, okay. Uh, kids, playtime's over. You know what, this is a good thing. Because either you're starting to doubt yourself, which is healthy, or —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't believe in the legend of goodbye kitty.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Or, you're starting to give a crap what other people think. Which is just another way of saying you give a crap about other people.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'd love to hear more of your theory, but I don't give a crap. Also, the pillcam's back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Polypoid. Raised edges.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Raised edges are actually necessary, since that's the opening to the appendix.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: How many times are we gonna watch this? There's no tumor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh my God, the death cat is attacking your legs. You're going to die.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Maybe it has something to do with that little red dot dancing around down there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh my God, the death laser is attacking your legs. You're going to die.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We're wasting time looking for cancer. She's still walking around. She's still pretty healthy. Maybe it's something minor.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Maybe we're not wasting time. We wouldn't have seen a flat lesion.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Skin cancer could have metastasized to the intestines. Cool. Check for melanomas.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Here, kitty, kitty, kitty. Come here. Here, kitty.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: It's not cancer. We found spider veins on her back. They weren't there when she came in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Spider veins means Cushing's. Could cause an abdominal disturbance, brown urine…

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: But the bronchospasm?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cushing's myopathy. It's uncommon but… Wait a second. You didn't wake me up to tell me a symptom that's not killing her. What else is going on?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I think she's dying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I just told you it's Cushing's. We treat…

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I don't mean because of the spider veins. Mr. Limpert died.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If that's my high school gym teacher…

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: It's your coma patient. He was stable for a year and a half, and he just died. The cat was right, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Here, puss, puss, puss, puss, puss.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Say "puss" one more time. It's the sixth "puss" that really does it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. Sulking will solve everything. That cat sat on my lap, and that cat knows something.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You believe it now?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yesterday it was all a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yesterday it was until I unintentionally proved it wasn't.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Patient must have Cushing's. We have to figure out whether it's based in…

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Cat's nose is powerful. It could smell liver or kidney failure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly, except if you'd glanced at the nursing home files I had faxed over this morning, you'd know that most of the patients' livers and kidneys were fine; what else?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: MRI‘s aren't telling us if the Cushing's in her adrenals or her brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So check her ACTH.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: A cat's vision is at the blue end of the spectrum.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: ACTH is 11.7. It's too close to tell. We can't treat the wrong organ 'cause that won't solve anything. She could have a cortisol storm. Could kill her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, maybe as the senior fellow you could have made sure that my doors were closed, so that I could be concentrating on the cat instead of looking for the cat.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You all right? Your nose.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What'd he say?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Sounds like he said "do you like cranberry juice?" Crap.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cheaper than fake blood. And more cran-tastic. Don't ever leave my door open like that again.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're playing pranks and this woman could be dying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So have Chase do a venous sampling in her brain. If he finds something, it's there. If he finds nothing, it's the adrenals.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not who I used to be. I'm scared. That's not a way to live. I want to come work for you.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Jeez, Chris, you didn't think… I didn't mean to imply that I could hire you right now.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You said you needed guys like me.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: I know, but… You don't have an MBA. And I just hired a chief medical officer.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Let me invest in that laser scalpel start-up. I got money saved. Not a ton but…

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: We put in a $2 million minimum for the first round financing. Look, I guess I could take you on at a smaller number. But you have to understand, it wouldn't be some quick payoff.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. I know it's not gonna change my life overnight. I just need to start changing it.

utterance.speaker: Neil
utterance.content: Okay then, let's start.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What exactly are you hoping to find inside your dead coma guy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Catnip. Chew toy. I don't know. That's why I'm looking…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Your patient had cardiac arrest during the venous sampling. We got her back, but her heart's still tenuous.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That tell us anything?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's weak, possibly dying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So nothing. What about the ACTH?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Slightly elevated.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That confirms the Cushing's is in the brain… go.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Are you sure that it's Cushing's? You'd expect central body obesity. She's in good shape.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If it had a normal presentation, there wouldn't be a cat involved.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So it's the brain. That means the next question is whether to remove the pituitary right now…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's not a question for me. That's a question for the patient. You'll present both sides and let her decide.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I've got to stop telling you my theories. You always just try to prove me wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You mean the theory about Cuddy's ass getting bigger at the full moon? I confirmed that one. Photo’s on my blog.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Normally, you'd be up in the patient room hectoring her on what to do. Instead you're up to your elbows in some irrelevant dead guy who may or may not be connected to a magic cat because you want to prove to me that you don't care.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Case is over. I'm exploring a scientific mystery.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I put up with your obsessions. I even encourage them for one reason: they save lives. I don't know what you're doing now.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cushing's means your body's overproducing a hormone called cortisol. The recommended course of action is to suppress it with drugs.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: And that will cure it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just treat it. It could come back. The only permanent solution is to cut into your brain and remove your pituitary gland, but the surgery's dangerous. Your heart stopped on the table once already.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I want the surgery. This thing is gonna kill me if I don't kill it first.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because of the cat?

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: Do you want to tell me what an idiot I'm being?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. I really believe that there are things that science can't understand. That there is a role for faith and prayer. But it's in the waiting room. Not the O.R.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: There's a reason I got sick. There's a reason for all the bad things that have happened to me. I don't know what that reason is. But I know that if there isn't one… If there's no greater purpose in the world. Then it's not a world I want to live in.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll schedule an operating room.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Early.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not staying long. I'm quitting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got a new job?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well then, you're not quitting. See you back here tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're not accepting my resignation?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Easier this way. It avoids the whole thing where you panic, run back and grovel, and I punish you and then take you back.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bring donuts. Everyone loves those bear claws.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Here, puss, puss, puss, puss, puss. Puss?

utterance.speaker: Secretary
utterance.content: Mr. Taub.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I've been waiting 15 minutes. Where's Neil?

utterance.speaker: Secretary
utterance.content: Neil doesn't work here anymore.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's the CEO.

utterance.speaker: Secretary
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I wish I could help you. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This is crazy. I'm investing with his company.

utterance.speaker: Secretary
utterance.content: He doesn't have a company. He worked here, but he was a receptionist, a temp.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Where is he?

utterance.speaker: Secretary
utterance.content: He's in custody. I really am not supposed to say anything else.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I went to high school with him.

utterance.speaker: Secretary
utterance.content: That's what everyone else thought too. I'm guessing you also cured his ear problem. Did you give him the money yet?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was right. And more satisfyingly, you were wrong. It was a coincidence. The cat was not predicting deaths. It was just trying to keep warm.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, dead people are renowned for their warm glow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They are if they're feverish, like three of the patients were. Or if they're wasting away, like the other eight.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Wasting doesn't…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, it does. If it means someone sticks a heating blanket on you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Congrats. Because of your crazy obsession with this cat, you've solved a completely trivial mystery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Completely trivial. My God. It's clearly only partially trivial. Debbie climbed on Morgan too, which means she was overheated. So what causes flushing and mimics every Cushing's symptom except central body obesity?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Cancer. A corticotropin-producing carcinoid tumor of the intestine. But your pillcam didn't find anything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Means it must be somewhere the pillcam couldn't go.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The appendix. Congratulations, you probably saved her life. You definitely saved her needless surgery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, I did. What's the O.R. extension number? Just curious.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I wouldn't come here for thanks. That would be ungracious. It's more about gloating. You were about to cut out a piece of your brain just to chase some crazy superstition.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: But I didn't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You "didn't" didn't do anything. I stopped it.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: And what made you do that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Science. Logic. Reason. Pick any three.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: A cat chooses that exact moment to sit on your computer. Maybe that's science and logic and reason or maybe it's something else.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: I looked up the preacher from New York State. His followers never faded out. They became the Seventh Day Adventists. A major religion. That man changed the course of history.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because his followers were as deluded as he was.

utterance.speaker: Morgan
utterance.content: Maybe he just gave them something to live for.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Feel better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kutner! Cat pee on my chair?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Blood on my face?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fake blood! You pay for the dry-cleaning.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Why are you still alive?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I’m not sure.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I guess he was impressed that you stood up to him — and got a cat to pee on his chair.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Yeah, a cat!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah.
